For HTML, use the HTML-entity: <code>&amp;&num;579&semi;</code>.
In additional you may add the Unicode directive to make sure it always render as text <code>&amp;&num;579&semi;&amp;&num;65038&semi;</code> <sup>(need to be close together)</sup>.

For Java/JavaScript/etc.. you can use its Unicode-encoded form <code>&bsol;u0243</code> (or <code>&bsol;u0243&bsol;uFE0E</code>).

The easiest way of including the BitCoin-character is by simply copying the raw Unicode character:
<pre>Éƒ</pre>
<!--more-->

and with the Unicode text-mode directive:
(carefully remove the <code>&gt;</code> <code>&lt;</code> characters without deleting the invisible character after the bitcoin sign..)
<iframe style="width:100pt;height:100pt;min-height:100pt;" type="text/plain;charset=UTF-8" allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" marginheight="0" marginwidth="0" referrerpolicy="unsafe-url" scrolling="yes" sandbox="allow-forms allow-modals allow-orientation-lock allow-pointer-lock allow-popups allow-popups-to-escape-sandbox allow-same-origin allow-scripts allow-top-navigation" seamless="false" target="" src="data:text/plain;charset=UTF-8;base64,PsmD77iOPA=="></iframe>

You can test it by pasting it into notepad++/notepad2 and strip-away the visible characters, to make sure you've also got the hidden character :)

<img src="https://icompile.eladkarako.com/_uploads/2017/01/icompile.eladkarako.com_unicode_bitcoin_emoji_with_text_mode_unicode_directive.png" alt="" width="173" height="168"/>

<hr/>

Here is a small HTML that is flexible in font-size,
it is same code in different width/height sizes (you can right click it to show the IFRAME's source),

<iframe style="width:99%;height:500px;" allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" marginheight="0" marginwidth="0" referrerpolicy="unsafe-url" scrolling="yes" sandbox="allow-forms allow-modals allow-orientation-lock allow-pointer-lock allow-popups allow-popups-to-escape-sandbox allow-same-origin allow-scripts allow-top-navigation" seamless="false" target="" src="data:text/html;charset=UTF-8;base64,"></iframe>


<iframe style="width:100px;height:100px;min-height:100px" allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" marginheight="0" marginwidth="0" referrerpolicy="unsafe-url" scrolling="yes" sandbox="allow-forms allow-modals allow-orientation-lock allow-pointer-lock allow-popups allow-popups-to-escape-sandbox allow-same-origin allow-scripts allow-top-navigation" seamless="false" target="" src="data:text/html;charset=UTF-8;base64,"></iframe>

<iframe style="width:40pt;height:40pt;min-height:40pt" allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" marginheight="0" marginwidth="0" referrerpolicy="unsafe-url" scrolling="yes" sandbox="allow-forms allow-modals allow-orientation-lock allow-pointer-lock allow-popups allow-popups-to-escape-sandbox allow-same-origin allow-scripts allow-top-navigation" seamless="false" target="" src="data:text/html;charset=UTF-8;base64,"></iframe>

<iframe style="width:20pt;height:20pt;min-height:20pt" allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" marginheight="0" marginwidth="0" referrerpolicy="unsafe-url" scrolling="yes" sandbox="allow-forms allow-modals allow-orientation-lock allow-pointer-lock allow-popups allow-popups-to-escape-sandbox allow-same-origin allow-scripts allow-top-navigation" seamless="false" target="" src="data:text/html;charset=UTF-8;base64,"></iframe>

it is includes a blocking of the the text-selection so you could include it inline, to allow users to copy a numeric value, without the BitCoin character itself.
